21.text:
(Applause) JERRY:
Hello, everyone. Thank you for

24.text:
joining us again today. We
appreciate you watching our

26.text:
broadcast. And thank you for all
of those of you who communicate

30.text:
with us and let us know how much
this broadcast is ministering to

34.text:
you and helping you to learn who
you are in Christ, helping you

38.text:
to learn how to live in victory,
helping you to find out that you

43.text:
are to be a winner in life.
That's what God wants, because

46.text:
when you're winning in life, it
makes him attractive to the

50.text:
world. Amen? AUDIENCE: Amen.
JERRY: Thank you, audience, for

52.text:
being here with us today.
Appreciate you joining in

54.text:
and--and helping me get this
message across. So keep pulling

58.text:
it out of me, okay? (Laughter)
All right. Let's open our Bibles

61.text:
today to John, Chapter 17. And
we began last week talking about

66.text:
"Walking in Divine Favor." We're
going to continue that lesson

70.text:
today as well as for the next
two weeks. So this will be a

74.text:
four-week study on "Walking in
Divine Favor." I've taught this

78.text:
many times on this broadcast,
but as I said last week, it just

82.text:
never hurts to hear it again.
AUDIENCE: Come on. That's right.

85.text:
JERRY: Faith cometh by hearing,
and hearing by the Word of God.

88.text:
AUDIENCE: Come on. Amen. JERRY:
You know, even when I hear

89.text:
myself preaching it, it stirs me
up. Praise God. AUDIENCE: That's

92.text:
right. JERRY: And I've known
this for years and years. But it

95.text:
just stirs you up every time you
hear it. AUDIENCE: That's right.

98.text:
JERRY: So hopefully that's
what'll happen to you today.

100.text:
Let's begin in Verse 20. Now,
this is Jesus, and he's actually

105.text:
praying to the Father. And it
says, in Verse 20, "Neither pray

109.text:
I for these alone." Now, "these
alone" was a reference to his

114.text:
disciples, those that were with
him that very day. He says,

118.text:
"Neither pray I for these alone,
but for them also which shall

124.text:
believe on me through their
word." Now, who is he talking

128.text:
about? He's talking about us.
AUDIENCE: Amen. JERRY: Because

131.text:
I'm a product of what these men
preach. They preached it. It

135.text:
went from one generation to
another until it eventually

138.text:
reached me. So right there in
Verse 20, I'm in the Bible.

143.text:
Praise God. AUDIENCE: Amen. Come
on. JERRY: You're in the Bible.

145.text:
Hallelujah. AUDIENCE: Come one.
JERRY: I like to say Jesus was

148.text:
looking beyond just those 12,
and he saw you and me. Praise

152.text:
God. So if you're a follower of
Christ, you are included in this

157.text:
prayer. So let's read what else
he says, "That they may be one;

161.text:
as thou, Father, art in me, and
I in thee, that they also may be

165.text:
one in us, that the world may
believe that thou hast sent me.

169.text:
And the glory which thou gavest
me I have given them; that they

174.text:
may be one, even as we are one:
I in them, thou in me, that they

179.text:
may be made perfect in one; that
the world may know that thou

182.text:
hast sent me." Now, I read all
that prayer just to get to this

187.text:
last line. So if you highlight
your Bible, highlight this. If

191.text:
you underline it, underline it.
Do something so this next verse

196.text:
or this latter part of this
verse will jump out at you every

199.text:
time you pass by John, Chapter
17. Notice the prayer, "that

204.text:
they will know that thou hast
loved them, as thou hast loved

210.text:
me." Now, the first time I read
that was February 1969. I had

218.text:
just surrendered my life to the
Lord. And, you know, I have

223.text:
accepted the call to preach, I'm
getting ready to shut my

226.text:
business down. I owned an
automotive business. I'm about

229.text:
to shut it down so I can prepare
for full-time ministry. And so,

234.text:
I'm sitting in our little guest
bedroom there in Shreveport,

238.text:
Louisiana, where I--where I
lived at the time, and where my

241.text:
wife and I grew up. And I'm
sitting in that little guest

245.text:
bedroom, put a desk in there for
me to study, and I read that

250.text:
verse. Now, I'm not--I'm not
very spiritually or scripturally

258.text:
educated at this point. I don't
know a whole lot about the

261.text:
Bible. Now, my wife grew up in
this. She grew up in a

266.text:
Pentecostal church, Full Gospel
church. She grew up in Oral

270.text:
Robert's crusades, T.L. Osborn
meeting. I mean, she's--she's

274.text:
been around this all of her
life. She got baptized in the

279.text:
Holy Ghost when she was eight
years old. And so here I am, I'm

283.text:
reading this, and it looks like,
to me, that Jesus just said,

288.text:
"Show them that you love them as
much as you love me." I thought,

295.text:
"There's a misprint in the
Bible." (Laughter) Somebody has

299.text:
written something in there that
don't belong in there. Jesus is

304.text:
praying that you and I will get
a revelation of the fact that

311.text:
God loves us just as much as he
loves Jesus. AUDIENCE: That's

315.text:
right. Amen. JERRY: Can you
fathom that? Can you take that

318.text:
in? AUDIENCE: Come on now.
JERRY: I thought, "That's got to

320.text:
be a misprint. He couldn't
possibly love me as much as he

325.text:
loves Jesus." But notice, it's
in red. Jesus said it. AUDIENCE:

328.text:
Yes. JERRY: Amen? AUDIENCE:
That's right. JERRY: And Jesus,

331.text:
one of his names is the truth.
AUDIENCE: That's right. Amen.

334.text:
JERRY: This is not a lie. This
is the truth. The truth. He's

337.text:
telling us the truth that God
loves us just as much as he

343.text:
loves Jesus. AUDIENCE: That's
right. JERRY: Now, folks, when

345.text:
you get a revelation of that,
I'm telling you your days of

348.text:
failure and defeat are over.
AUDIENCE: That's right. JERRY:

350.text:
That means no matter what you've
done, no matter what part of

355.text:
town you grew up in, no matter
what the color of your skin

358.text:
might be, no matter what culture
you came out of, if you'll make

363.text:
Jesus the Lord of your life,
then I promise you you're going

367.text:
to learn that he loves you just
as much as he loves Jesus.

371.text:
AUDIENCE: Yes. JERRY: And if he
loves you that much, then surely

375.text:
you must have favor with him.
AUDIENCE: Amen. JERRY: Praise

377.text:
God. AUDIENCE: That's right.
JERRY: You have right standing

379.text:
with him. Can you say, "Amen,"
to that? Praise God. AUDIENCE:

382.text:
Amen. JERRY: Amen? That's how
much he loves you. I want you to

386.text:
say it out loud, those of you at
home right along with this

388.text:
audience, "God loves me--"
AUDIENCE: God loves me-- JERRY:

392.text:
"--just as much as he loves
Jesus." AUDIENCE: --just as much

395.text:
as he loves Jesus. JERRY: Now,
be careful saying that around

397.text:
religious people. Some of them
still have rocks, you know?

400.text:
(Laughter) I mean, you know, the
religious people in Jesus' day,

403.text:
they loved carrying rocks around
with them. They were masters at

407.text:
stoning people that didn't agree
with them, you know. So,

411.text:
religious people--I mean, you
talk about making them mad. When

414.text:
you go around saying, "God loves
me as much as he loves Jesus,"

419.text:
the first time I told a group
that I thought were Christians

422.text:
then, I thought they were going
to--I thought they were going to

425.text:
push me off a cliff. "Who do you
think you are? You're three

428.text:
months old in the Lord, and you
think he really loves you as

431.text:
much as he loves Jesus?" Well,
that's what the Bible says.

434.text:
AUDIENCE: Amen. JERRY: "Yeah,
but we know better." No, you

436.text:
don't know better, not if you're
not agreeing with the Bible.

439.text:
AUDIENCE: Come on. JERRY: Amen.
And it made them so mad that I'd

443.text:
go around saying, "Did you know
God loves me as much as he loves

447.text:
Jesus? Not only that, I have
right standing with God--"

450.text:
AUDIENCE: That's right. JERRY:
"--and I have favor with God"?

453.text:
AUDIENCE: Amen. JERRY: "I'm
telling you, I've got it made.

456.text:
Hallelujah." AUDIENCE: Amen.
JERRY: Oh, it would make them so

457.text:
mad. You know, they wanted me to
suffer. They wanted me to, you

462.text:
know, to tribulate and--and be
poor and sick and--and miserable

467.text:
like they were. AUDIENCE: Right.
JERRY: I tried that. I didn't

469.text:
like it. That's the reason I got
saved. Hallelujah. (Laughter)

471.text:
Amen? Praise the Lord. So
notice, he loves us just as much

477.text:
as he loves his Son. And once
again, if he loves us that much,

481.text:
then surely we have favor with
him. Now, listen to something

485.text:
else he says. Before I read this
from Numbers, let me give you a

489.text:
statement, a phrase that you
ought to write down and carry

492.text:
around with you. "You are
the object of God's affection."

496.text:
AUDIENCE: Amen. JERRY: I love
that. You're the object of God's

500.text:
affection. In Numbers 6:25-26,
it says that "God will make his

509.text:
face shine upon thee, and be
gracious unto thee." Now, I

516.text:
wrote in my Bible, after reading
that, "I am the object of God's

521.text:
affection. He will make his face
shine upon me and be gracious

526.text:
unto me." Now, another word for
"gracious" is "favorable." The

531.text:
word, "grace," and the word,
"favor," are synonymous. So when

535.text:
you talk about the grace of God,
you're talking about the favor

538.text:
of God. And here in Numbers
6:25-26, it says that God will

546.text:
be favorable unto you. The
Amplified Bible says, "He will

551.text:
be gracious, he will be kind, he
will be merciful, and he will

556.text:
give favor to you." Hallelujah.
AUDIENCE: Yes. Hallelujah.

559.text:
JERRY: Folks, when are we just
going to believe the Bible?

561.text:
AUDIENCE: That's right. Amen.
JERRY: You know, why don't we

563.text:
let the Bible be final
authority-- AUDIENCE: That's

565.text:
right. JERRY: --not religious
tradition, not what some

567.text:
denomination says-- AUDIENCE:
That's right. JERRY: --not what

569.text:
Grandma believed. We love
Grandma, but Grandma might have

572.text:
been wrong. Amen? (Laughter) So
we've got to believe what the

576.text:
Bible says. AUDIENCE: Amen.
JERRY: And it says that he will

579.text:
give favor to you. Are you
getting this? Praise God.

583.text:
AUDIENCE: Yes, sir. JERRY: Are
you at home getting this?

585.text:
AUDIENCE: Come on now. JERRY:
Now, you have favor with God. He

588.text:
wants you to know that he's on
your side. He wants you to know

591.text:
that he will never let you down.
He will never fail you. Why?

596.text:
Because you have favor with him.
AUDIENCE: That's right. JERRY:

598.text:
You know, think about it in
terms of relationship. You know,

602.text:
when you have a relationship
with someone and it is a deep

606.text:
relationship, then you can ask
that person for a favor and

612.text:
they'll probably grant it even
before they know what it is,

615.text:
amen, because of your
relationship. AUDIENCE: That's

618.text:
right. JERRY: You know, Kenneth
Copeland, my spiritual father,

623.text:
and I have had a long term
relationship, almost 47 years

627.text:
now. And we not only have
preached together all these

632.text:
years in covenant with one
another, our families are in

635.text:
covenant with one another, but
we're very close and intimate

639.text:
friends, and we have great
respect, mutual respect, for one

644.text:
another, one another's office in
ministry, one another's

647.text:
anointing. You know, and I
know--and I've done it and he's

652.text:
done it. I know that I can go to
Brother Copeland if I needed to

656.text:
and say to him, "Brother
Copeland, I need a favor," and I

662.text:
know exactly what he's going to
say. "Okay, what is it?" And

666.text:
then usually he'll say this,
"That's what I'm here for." You

669.text:
know, "That's what I'm here
for." See, that's covenant--

671.text:
AUDIENCE: Amen. JERRY: --you
know? There have been times

675.text:
where my airplane might be in
the shop, having work done on

679.text:
it, an annual or something, and
I needed to be somewhere. I

682.text:
said, "Brother Copeland, I need
a favor. Can I use your

684.text:
airplane?" "Well, of course.
What's mine is yours." That's

687.text:
his attitude. What is that based
on? Relationship. AUDIENCE:

690.text:
That's right. Yeah. JERRY:
Relationship. Amen. I remember

693.text:
one time I was preaching in
Tulsa at the Mabee Center on the

698.text:
Oral Roberts University Campus.
And there were probably 4,000 or

701.text:
5,000 people in this meeting.
And after the--I got through

705.text:
preaching, I invited people to
come forward that--that needed

709.text:
prayer for various things. And I
noticed in the line was a couple

714.text:
who were partners with my
ministry. I also knew that they

717.text:
were partners with Brother
Roberts, they were partners with

720.text:
Brother Kenneth Hagin, Brother
Kenneth Copeland. And I knew the

723.text:
church they went to. They were
faithful tithers. I knew their

725.text:
pastor. These are givers.
And--and--and I knew they owned

729.text:
a business that had been quite
successful. And they were in the

733.text:
prayer line. And I recognized
them and I--I immediately

737.text:
wondered, "What is it that they
need prayer for?" So when I got

740.text:
to them, I called them by their
name. I said, "What is it that

744.text:
you need prayer for?" And--and
they began to cry. And they

747.text:
said, "Brother Jerry, you know
us. You know we're faithful

749.text:
partners with a number of
ministries, and we're tithers.

752.text:
God has blessed us over the
years." And said, "We are going

758.text:
through the worst financial
attack on our business that we

761.text:
have ever experienced." And
said, "And if something doesn't

765.text:
change soon, we're going to lose
everything." Well, boy, the

768.text:
compassion of God came all over
me. I said, "Lord, this is not

772.text:
right. These are--these are
partners. These are tithers.

776.text:
These are covenant people. This
is not right. And I remember

780.text:
praying. I--I remember hearing
myself pray over them, but I

785.text:
heard something came out of me
that I don't ever remember

788.text:
praying quite that way before. I
said--as I laid my hands on

791.text:
them, I said, "Lord, as a favor
to me, turn my partners'

798.text:
financial situation." And--and
they said, "Amen." I said,

803.text:
"Amen." And they left and took
their seat. I mean, you couldn't

807.text:
tell anything had changed in the
natural. I mean, we're there in

810.text:
that meeting, you know? There
wasn't a thousand--thousands of

815.text:
dollars falling from the sky
into that auditorium. So we

818.text:
couldn't tell anything had
changed in the natural. But I

821.text:
remember walking away thinking,
"Man, I don't remember ever

824.text:
praying like that before, 'As a
favor to me, Lord, change my

830.text:
partners' financial situation.'"
Well, I got home. I had several

835.text:
other meetings, but I got home
and this was about a week later.

838.text:
And they called me and said,
"Brother Jerry, we just had to

841.text:
call you and tell you what
happened." Said, "We have had

844.text:
the greatest financial
breakthrough we have ever

847.text:
experienced in our lives and we
just want to thank you for your

851.text:
prayers." And I rejoiced with
them over the phone and, when I

854.text:
hung up, I said, "Lord, that
sure was quick." He said, "Well,

859.text:
didn't you ask me for a favor?"
And I remember saying to him,

862.text:
"Lord, you mean I carry that
much weight with you?" He said,

867.text:
"You have no idea how much
weight you carry with me."

870.text:
AUDIENCE: Come on. JERRY: I
thought, "I'm going to start

872.text:
praying this way more often.
Praise God." AUDIENCE: Amen.

874.text:
JERRY: He said, "Well, just
remember now, when you ask me

877.text:
for a favor, I might ask you for
a few." AUDIENCE: That's right.

879.text:
JERRY: Amen? AUDIENCE: That's
right. That's right. JERRY: And

883.text:
he has. AUDIENCE: Yeah.
(Laughter) JERRY: You know, God

885.text:
wake you up in the middle of the
night, say, "I need for you to

887.text:
get up and pray for somebody as
a favor to me--" AUDIENCE: Yes.

890.text:
Come on. JERRY: --you've got to
reciprocate. AUDIENCE: That's

893.text:
right. JERRY: Amen. God may ask
you for a few favors. Well, be

898.text:
obedient. Do them quickly and
quietly. Isn't that the way you

901.text:
want God to respond to your
prayer? AUDIENCE: Yes. JERRY:

903.text:
Quickly and quietly. Praise God.
Amen. Excuse me. So once again,

909.text:
we have favor with God. That
means we--we carry weight with

915.text:
him, praise God, not based on
anything we've done, but based

919.text:
entirely on what Jesus did. Can
you say, "Amen"? AUDIENCE: Amen.

923.text:
JERRY: The favor that you and I
have with God, we didn't earn

926.text:
it. AUDIENCE: That's right.
JERRY: Look at your neighbor and

928.text:
say, "I didn't earn this."
AUDIENCE: I didn't earn this.

930.text:
JERRY: Say, "I didn't do a
thing." AUDIENCE: I didn't do a

931.text:
thing. JERRY: No. It was Jesus--
AUDIENCE: Amen. JERRY: --who

934.text:
earned it for you. It was Jesus
who bought and paid for it. So

938.text:
your responsibility is to
receive it. AUDIENCE: That's

942.text:
right. JERRY: Don't fuss with
it. Don't fight it. Receive it.

946.text:
AUDIENCE: Come on. JERRY: Enjoy
it and learn how to walk in it

948.text:
for the rest of your life. I--I
want to also remind you that

953.text:
favor, since it can't be earned,
it's a gift. AUDIENCE: Yes.

957.text:
Amen. JERRY: Amen? AUDIENCE:
That's right. JERRY: How do you

959.text:
respond when someone wants to
give you a gift? AUDIENCE:

961.text:
That's right. JERRY: I'll show
you how you respond. (Laughter)

963.text:
Vic, stand up right here. Just
stand up right there. I give you

973.text:
this $20 as a gift? Did you
notice he reached for it?

976.text:
(Laughter) This is not just an
illustration. It's yours. I'm

980.text:
giving it to you. It's a gift.
VIC: Thank you. JERRY: Anybody

983.text:
else want to play? (Laughter)
No. You just--it's a gift. I

988.text:
gave it to you. And did you
notice he didn't say, "I'm so

991.text:
unworthy. I don't deserve that
$20. Oh, Brother Jerry, I'm just

996.text:
a worm in your sight."
(Laughter) No. He reached for it

1000.text:
immediately. AUDIENCE: Right.
JERRY: That's the way you ought

1002.text:
to-- AUDIENCE: That's right.
JERRY: --be about the favor of

1004.text:
God. If God is saying, "It's a
gift," say, "I receive it."

1007.text:
AUDIENCE: Woo! Amen. JERRY: Come
on. Reach up there like this and

1010.text:
say, "I receive it." AUDIENCE: I
receive it! Yeah. JERRY: It's

1012.text:
mine. Amen? AUDIENCE: That's
right. Woo. JERRY: I have the

1014.text:
favor of God. It's a gift from
God. AUDIENCE: Amen. Hallelujah.

1017.text:
JERRY: Amen? It belongs to me.
Once again, not because I'm so

1022.text:
good, but because he's so good.
Praise God. AUDIENCE: That's

1025.text:
right. JERRY: Can you say,
"Amen?" AUDIENCE: Amen. JERRY:

1027.text:
So you're the object of God's
affection. He's given you his

1031.text:
favor as a gift. Your
responsibility is to receive it,

1035.text:
enjoy it-- AUDIENCE: Yes. JERRY:
And learn how to walk in it

1039.text:
every day of your life.
AUDIENCE: Amen. JERRY: When you

1041.text:
learn how to walk in the favor
of God, you're going to find

1044.text:
that needs will be supplied like
never before. Praise God.

1048.text:
AUDIENCE: Hallelujah. JERRY:
You're going to find that a lot

1050.text:
of the struggling that you've
gone through is going to cease.

1053.text:
Praise God. AUDIENCE: Amen.
JERRY: You just have this

1055.text:
confidence that, "If God is on
my side, if I have favor with

1059.text:
him, then why wouldn't he supply
my need?" AUDIENCE: Amen. JERRY:

1062.text:
Why wouldn't he answer my
prayer? AUDIENCE: Amen. JERRY:

1064.text:
Amen? Why wouldn't he take care
of me? Now, I ask you this

1068.text:
question: Isn't it wonderful
having the favor of God?

1071.text:
AUDIENCE: Hallelujah. JERRY:
Somebody give him a good shout

1074.text:
of praise. Amen? AUDIENCE:
Hallelujah! Glory! JERRY: Now,

1076.text:
let's define favor for a moment.
What is the favor of God? I want

1084.text:
to give you four definitions
here of what the favor of God

1087.text:
is. Number one, it's God
granting good will to us. It's

1093.text:
God granting good will to us.
Another word for "good will" is

1098.text:
"kindness." It's God granting
his kindness to us. Psalm 37:4

1105.text:
says, "Delight thyself also
in the Lord, and he shall grant

1110.text:
thee," or give thee, "the
desires of thine heart." You

1114.text:
know, religion's made it hard to
receive anything from God. But

1118.text:
he says, "Just delight yourself
in me, and I'll give you--not

1122.text:
only fulfill your needs, but I
will give you the desires of

1126.text:
your heart." AUDIENCE: That's
right. JERRY: Amen? AUDIENCE:

1128.text:
Amen. That's right. JERRY: I'm
telling you, God is good.

1130.text:
